page.title: 01Introduction to West Wight
page.content: This block was worked on by the 1st year of West Wight Middle School, situated at the Western end of the Isle of Wight. This block and the block immediately to the North form the area known as the West Wight. Being isolated from the rest of the Island gives us a unique atmosphere and close community spirit. The area is picturesque and relies heavily on the tourist industry. There are few local jobs apart from tourism and many people travel the 12 miles to Newport the Islands capital, to work. Much of the area is National Trust Land including downland designated as of Special Scientific interest. There is a Nature Reserve covering an area of Marshland. Freshwater is the largest village, home of the poet Alfred Lord Tennyson.
